remixlab.bias.branch

Interface Action<E extends Enum<E>>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - 'Reference' enum action set.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Constants.ClickAction, Constants.DOF1Action, Constants.DOF2Action, Constants.DOF3Action, Constants.DOF6Action, Constants.KeyboardAction, Constants.SceneAction

    public interface Action<E extends Enum<E>>
    Generic interface defining user action (sub)groups.

    (User-defined) actions in bias should be defined by a third-party simply using an Enum. This interface allows grouping items of that 'reference' action Enum (referenceAction()) together, thus possibly forming action sub-groups. Action subgroups are typically bound to different data input kinds (BogusEvent), such as that gathered from tap and drag gestures.

    Since the referenceAction() is used to parameterize an GenericGrabber object, each value in the action sub-group should be mapped to a value in the (see referenceAction()), otherwise the GenericGrabber wouldn't be able to discriminate among different data input kinds (e.g., a tap from a drag gesture).

    Note: all data input related to a single entity or device (such as the mouse) that binds an GenericGrabber is handled by agent Branches.

    Observation Enums provide an easy (typical) implementation of this Interface. For example, given the following global Action set: 

     
 public enum GlobalAction {
   CHANGE_COLOR,
   CHANGE_STROKE_WEIGHT,
   CHANGE_POSITION,
   CHANGE_SHAPE
 }
    An implementation of an Action group defined with the CHANGE_POSITION and CHANGE_SHAPE items, would then look like this: 
     
 public enum MotionAction implements Action<GlobalAction> {
   CHANGE_POSITION(GlobalAction.CHANGE_POSITION), 
   CHANGE_SHAPE(GlobalAction.CHANGE_SHAPE);
   
   public GlobalAction referenceAction() {
     return act;
   }
 
   public String description() {
     return "A simple motion action";
   }
 
   GlobalAction act;
 
   MotionAction(GlobalAction a) {
     act = a;
   }
 }

      String description()
      Returns a description of the action.
      E referenceAction()
      Returns group to reference-action mappings.
